documents.document: “There are three things I always forget. Names, faces and… the third I can’t remember.” ~Italo Svevo #quote
@just1heather …but *not* a proper nerd. You proved it wrong yourself with that statement ;)
@just1heather Thank you so much, you too! :) Regarding your question: you are obviously a good family person ;)
#FF & RT thanks @Jenntrick @bautistaespinal @cricket27L @crispyoinkie @natzcantik @maracandelaria @SUPERRROCKSTAR @stubbornone12 @BLK_Magnum
@Jenntrick Jenn! Thank you, you have a new nick :)
“Tell me who admires you and loves you, and I will tell you who you are.” ~Charles Augustin Sainte-Beuve #quote
RT @Jim_Rohn_Quotes: “Learn to say ‘no’ to the good, so you can say ‘yes’ to the great.” ~Jim Rohn #jimrohn #quote
“If you want things to stay as they are, things will have to change.” ~Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa #quote
“A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.” ~W. C. Fields #quote
“The saddest thing I can imagine is to get used to luxury.” ~Sir Charles ‘Charlie’ Chaplin #quote
“The measure of your quality as a public person, as a citizen, is the gap between what you do and what you say.” ~Ramsey Clark #life #quote
@SUPERRROCKSTAR Props and kudos ;)
@just1heather You’re *obviously* not a proper nerd ;)
“Do nerds never sleep?” ~Joan Severance #quote
“It takes no more time to see the good side of life than it takes to see the bad.” ~Jimmy Buffett #quote
“Caffeine—the gateway drug.” ~Eddie Vedder #quote
“Enthusiasm—the sustaining power of all great action.” ~Samuel Smiles #quote
“Anger is seldom without argument but seldom with a good one.” ~E. F. L. Wood, 1st Earl of Halifax #quote
“Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don’t quit.” ~Conrad Hilton #quote
“There are no ugly women, only lazy ones.” ~Helena Rubinstein #quote
One more for the ladies… ;)
“A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.” ~Anne Roiphe #quote
“Trying is failing with honor.” ~@Oprah #quote (via @ArmiAnneFrances)
“A loving person lives in a loving world. A hostile person lives in a hostile world. Everyone you meet is your mirror.” ~Ken Keyes Jr #quote
“We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.” ~Carlos Castaneda #quote
@NatashaD83 Yes, plural, even better ;)
“I’d rather lose myself in passion than lose my passion.” ~Jacques Mayol #quote
“A day without laughter is a day wasted.” ~Sir Charles ‘Charlie’ Chaplin #quote
“If they give you ruled paper, write the other way.” ~Juan Ramón Jiménez #creativity #quote
“Character—like a photograph—develops in darkness.” ~Yousuf Karsh #quote
“If I lay here, if I just lay here, would you lie with me, and just forget the world?” ~Gary Lightbody #lyrics #MusicMonday
“Out of my reach, out of my hands, I didn’t understand, I would have changed all my plans” ~Milow #lyrics #MusicMonday
“Help, I’m alive, my heart keeps beating like a hammer.” ~Emily Haines / Metric #lyrics #MusicMonday
“Drinking, water to stay thin, or is it to purify? I love you all the same” ~Bradfield/Moore/Wire #lyrics #MusicMonday
“You can never say never, why we don’t know when, time and time again, younger now then we were before” ~The Fray #lyrics #MusicMonday
“I despise a world which does not feel that music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.” ~Ludwig van Beethoven #quote #mm
To be kind to all, to like many and love a few, to be needed and wanted by those we love, is certainly the nearest we can come to happiness.
How about one #quote without any tags or even quotation marks, simply because of the 140 char limit. It is by Mary I of Scotland:
@sarahjcarter Let’s see if I can rid myself of what has already become somewhat of a habit ;)
@sarahjcarter Appearing in relevant search results would give more minds the chance to be stimulated :)
@beamse Please don’t! :)
“True friendship consists not in the multitude of friends, but in their worth and value.” ~Benjamin ‘Ben’ Jonson #quote <- just one tag ;)
I have officially the best tweeps around here. Well, I don’t really ‘own’ you as such, but you get the idea ;)
Thank you so much @danielleraexx @just1heather @ObinnaEboh @larrrrs @czaucha @SugarCoatedTzu @sarahjcarter @goodbye2romance :)
Well, this was educational. We should do this more often :)
@sarahjcarter That’s it, precisely. I’m still not sure which is better and which is worse :)
How about #tags then? They are potentially a little annoying and too interpretive. How do you feel about tags like #courage #honesty etc?
Excellent replies, thanks guys! You are beautiful :) I have one more related question.
Just to clarify: by ‘obscure’ I don’t mean what my second cousin’s teacher told him at the spring break of ’84. Just lesser known good ones.
Would you want me to stick to the classics, or would you be interested in discovering more obscure good quotes?
…a lot of quotes around, I’d like to tweet more than that one from Einstein, a couple of Emersons and Twains, etc. The classic ones. So…
Awesome :) So, I’ve noticed that everyone and their granny is tweeting quotes as of late, which is very cool in itself, but since there are…
Actually, there’s a quotes related question that I’d like to ask all of you. Are you ready?
@bautistaespinal Now that’s really cool. I feel super international ;)
“The man with the ball is responsible for what happens to the ball.” ~Branch Rickey #GQ #responsibility #quote
Big RT thanks also to @Her_Heart2Soul @MsDivaRoyale @BLK_Magnum @senorita20 @PearlKelly @xoJovonixo :)
@AmandeeTweets Thank you for your numerous RTs, Amanda. Much appreciated :)
@OuttaHerrrrreee Hey Mr. Phillies, it’s been ages! Thanks for the kind RT :)
“Believe deep down in your heart that you’re destined to do great things.” ~Joseph ‘Joe’ Paterno #GQ #greatness #quote
“Courage is fear that has said its prayers.” ~Dorothy Bernard #GQ #courage #quote
@MariposaBonita_ Just a reference to the need to make memories ;)
“…what comes to you, in a moment gone by, a glimpse of light, the everlasting road” ~Leslie Mills #lyrics #quote
“Someone to see all of you, without turning away, or being afraid…” ~Leslie Mills #lyrics #quote (via @ameadou)
@Leslie_Mills Entirely my pleasure. You are awesome ;)
@MariposaBonita_ Yes, you should. Preferably good ones ;)
Thank you very much for your RTs @maracandelaria @MsDivaRoyale @gemlala @SUPERRROCKSTAR :)
@BTspeaker Thank you Beth, very kind of you :)
@ameadou Yay, yes! Leslie is made of awesome :)
@Jenn_Chinn Good to hear you’re doing better! Also, thanks a lot for the kind #FF :)
@MsEm1122 Thank you em :)
@ObinnaEboh Thanks for the kind RTs bro :)
“!!!!!” ~Angry Mime (@AngryMime) #quote
“History is still happening.” ~Godfried Bomans #GQ #life #quote
“The ability to perceive or think differently is more important than the knowledge gained.” ~David Bohm #GQ #ingenuity #quote
“When women are depressed they eat or go shopping. Men invade another country. It’s a whole different way of thinking.” ~E. Boosler #quote
@cricket27L Really sweet of you, thank you! :)
@just1heather Thank you for your honesty ;)
“I am one of the few men honest enough to say they do not understand women.” ~Robert Menzies #GQ #honesty #quote
@SUPERRROCKSTAR Thank you for the RT :)
@Jenn_Chinn Aww, I hope you got some rest and that you’re doing better!
RT @Jim_Rohn_Quotes: “Success is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.” ~Jim Rohn #jimrohn #quote
@MariposaBonita_ My pleasure :)
RT, mention & #FF ♥ @MariposaBonita_ @Naomi_Rodriguez @attitudezarah @kukywa @indysimo @mamainside @focusvision @crispyoinkie @PearlKelly :)
“When a young man complains that a young lady has no heart, it’s pretty certain that she has his.” ~George D. Prentice #GQ #heart #quote
“…and the sweet song of wonder was all I could hear, that was my favorite year” ~Leslie Mills (@Leslie_Mills) #lyrics #quote
“That was my favorite year, the whole universe was alive with surprises…” ~Leslie Mills #lyrics #quote
Ok, I’m such a @Leslie_Mills fan now. Seriously. ♥
“…each new direction was perfectly clear, that was my favorite year” ~Leslie Mills #lyrics #quote
“That was my favorite year, love was around without end or beginning…” ~Leslie Mills #lyrics #quote
“…and I learned to take chances without any fear, that was my favorite year” ~Leslie Mills (@Leslie_Mills) #lyrics #quote <3
“That was my favorite year, when time stood still and I moved faster…” ~Leslie Mills #lyrics #quote
@misschanto “What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?” ~George Eliot #friendship #quote
@misschanto Awww, that is perhaps the sweetest thing ever. You have earned a super rare starred fave, my friend :) *hug*
“For all sad words of tongue and pen, the saddest are these, ‘it might have been.’” ~John Greenleaf Whittier #GQ #opportunity #quote
@aliarki Excellent! We should all be. You are setting a good example :)
@Monicutza03449 That’s great as well! Sweet dreams :)
Seems everyone’s still sleeping or working hard. Both are good options :)
Hello beautiful tweeps! How are you doing today?
“An entrepreneur assumes the risk and is dedicated and committed to the success of whatever he or she undertakes.” ~Victor Kiam #biz #quote
“Quotations are useful in periods of ignorance or obscurantist beliefs.” ~Guy Debord #GQ #quotes #quote
